isis.stitle: CAM AIR FOUNDATION BRAKES - ADJUSTING PUSH ROD

svcproc.title: ADJUSTING PUSH ROD

note.para: If the foregoing adjustment or relining of brake shoes does not achieve an angle near 90 degrees between push rod and slack adjuster with brakes applied, then the maximum force against the slack adjuster cannot be obtained. Readjust the push rod ( Figure 33).

If servicing a chamber with a spring (PARKING) brake, the spring chamber must be CAGED. Uncage brake after all adjustments are completed. Refer to GROUP 04 - BRAKES in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

step1.para: Disconnect slack adjuster and push rod.
Loosen lock nut on clevis and thread clevis onto push rod toward brake chamber for several turns.
Reconnect slack adjuster and push rod with clevis pin.

Apply brakes fully and check angle between slack adjuster and push rod. If 90 degrees or slightly more is not obtained, adjust push rod length until angle is satisfactory. If adjusting push rod with caged brakes, use a pry bar to move slack adjuster so that the lining is against the drum and check angle. Repeat adjustment until angle is satisfactory ( Figure 32 and Figure 33).

svcproc.para: Some spring brake type chambers have an orange-colored alert stroke indicator marked on the push rod ( Figure 34and Figure 35). For more detailed information, refer to GROUP 04 - BRAKES in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
